title: AAA Lawyers NSW Accident Management Training & Knowledge Website (PDF-sourced)

requirements.text: Create a public-facing website for the firm name “AAA Lawyers” that provides a structured knowledge base and training courses focused on accident management systems in NSW, Australia.

quotes: Create a website which gives knowledge and training courses which includes accident management systems in NSW AUSTRALIA ... and the the firm name is aaa lawyers

acceptanceCriteria: The site header/footer and page titles reference “AAA Lawyers”.
The homepage clearly presents two primary entry points: Knowledge Base and Training Courses.
All user-facing text is in English and consistently references NSW, Australia context.

requirements.text: Add a PDF-source ingestion workflow so administrators can use the provided PDF as the primary source for knowledge base articles and course content.

quotes: use the pdf as a source

acceptanceCriteria: An admin-only screen allows adding content from the PDF into the system (either by uploading the PDF for client-side text extraction or by pasting extracted text), without requiring external services.
Ingested content can be saved into structured entities (e.g., Article, Course, Module/Lesson) in the backend.
The user can view the resulting articles/lessons in the public Knowledge Base and Courses sections.

requirements.text: Implement a Knowledge Base section containing navigable articles derived from the PDF covering NSW accident management systems, recovery process from at-fault insurers, and guidance for dealing with insurance companies in NSW.

quotes: create a complete knowledge of the recovery process from at fault insurer and how to deal with the insurance companies in NSW AUSTRALIA

acceptanceCriteria: Knowledge Base supports categories/tags at minimum: Accident Management Systems (NSW), Recovery from At-Fault Insurer (NSW), Dealing with Insurance Companies (NSW).
Users can browse article lists and open an article detail page.
Articles are persisted in the backend and loaded via React Query on the frontend.

requirements.text: Implement a Training Courses section with structured courses (course → modules/lessons) that trainees can follow to improve product knowledge related to NSW accident management and insurer recovery processes.

quotes: training courses ... by which trainees can improve their product knowledge and learn

acceptanceCriteria: Users can browse a list of courses and open a course detail page showing modules/lessons in order.
Each lesson supports rich text content stored in the backend.
Course content explicitly includes material on recovery process from at-fault insurers and how to deal with insurance companies in NSW (based on the PDF ingestion).

requirements.text: Add trainee sign-in using Internet Identity and track per-user learning progress (e.g., lesson completion and overall course progress).

quotes: trainees can improve their product knowledge and learn

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in/out with Internet Identity.
A signed-in user can mark lessons as complete.
Progress is persisted per user in the backend and reflected in the UI (e.g., completed indicators and % progress for a course).

requirements.text: Add lightweight knowledge checks for courses (e.g., short quizzes per module/lesson) so trainees can self-assess understanding.
acceptanceCriteria: Admins can create/edit quiz questions (at least multiple-choice) attached to a lesson or module.
Trainees can take quizzes and see whether answers are correct.
Quiz attempts/results are stored per user and viewable on the lesson/module screen.

requirements.text: Provide an admin-only content management area to create/edit/publish/unpublish Knowledge Base articles, Courses, Lessons, and Quizzes, including managing content derived from the PDF.

quotes: use the pdf as a source

acceptanceCriteria: Admin access is restricted (e.g., via a backend allowlist of admin principals).
Admins can create, edit, and delete draft content and publish/unpublish it.
Non-admin users cannot access admin routes or admin APIs.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme suitable for a professional NSW legal training site (consistent colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent theme is applied across layout, navigation, cards, and typography.
Theme avoids default-looking styling and is applied consistently on Home, Knowledge Base, Course pages, Lesson pages, and Admin pages.

requirements.text: Add basic site pages and navigation: Home, Knowledge Base, Courses, About AAA Lawyers, and a Contact page (static contact details placeholder text only, no email/SMS integrations).
acceptanceCriteria: Top-level navigation includes Home, Knowledge Base, Courses, About, Contact.
About page describes AAA Lawyers and the purpose of the training portal in general terms (no fabricated claims).
Contact page includes non-interactive placeholders for phone/email/address fields (no external service integration).

constraints: Use Motoko in a single backend actor for all backend logic.
Do not modify any files under frontend immutablePaths (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not use external databases or third-party auth providers; only Internet Identity for authentication.
nonGoals: Building a payment system or paid course enrollment.
Integrating external CRM/case management or insurer APIs.
Providing legal advice disclaimers beyond basic informational context unless explicitly requested by the user.

required: AAA Lawyers wordmark logo, clean typographic style (aaa-lawyers-logo.dim_512x256.png)
Hero banner illustration themed around training/learning and document review (nsw-training-hero.dim_1600x600.png)
Set of 3 simple monochrome icons: book, graduation cap, shield (training-icons-set.dim_512x512.png)
